name: Zero Proof: Papaya Lassi
description: Before Jamba Juice and Smoothie King took over our morning meals and afternoon snacks, there was the lassi. This yogurt-based beverage has been an Indian tradition for hundreds, and some say thousands, of years. A lassi can be either sweet or savory and is frequently served during the summer to combat the heat. This version is a variation on the tremendously popular North Indian mango lassi, using papaya and citrus for a bright and refreshing drink.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups ripe papaya, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1" cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Mix papaya, yogurt, lime juice, orange juice, honey, and salt in blender until smooth.
Add ice to blender and blend until smooth. Lassi should be thick.
